content:
• Friday, May 15, 2015
  • SUNW

    Solar3D up 4.2% after Q1 report

    • Solar3D (SLTD) has risen to $4.72 in AH trading after reporting Q1 revenue of $5.7M on the back of 5.5MW of solar sales. Revenue would have totaled $7.17M if all of recently-acquired MD Energy's Q1 sales were recorded, rather than just one month's worth.
    • The microcap reported a quarter-ending backlog of $14.7M (4.6MW) and cash balance of $11.2M. Gross margin rose to 34% from 26% a year ago, and operating expenses to $3M from $1.2M. The opex growth is said to be primarily due to one-time expenses.
    • Guidance for 2015 revenue of $40M-$45M and full-year profitability is reiterated.
    • Q1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 7:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharma up 13.6% on Paulson stake disclosure

    • Paulson & Co. took a 3.12M-share (3%) stake in Synergy Pharma (NASDAQ:SGYP) in Q1, the firm discloses in its Q1 13F.
    • Synergy has jumped to $4.00 in AH trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 PM | 6 Comments
  • PBR

    Petrobras posts surprising 50% Y/Y jump in Q1 adjusted earnings

    • Petrobras (NYSE:PBR) +3.3%Â AH after reporting a better than expected 50% jump in Q1 EBITDA to 21.5B reais ($7.2B) vs. 14.4B reais in the year-ago quarter and analyst consensus expectations for 17.5B reais.
    • Q1 net profit totaled 5.33B reais ($1.78B), down from 5.39B reais in the year-ago period, on revenue of 74.35B reais, down 9% Y/Y.
    • PBR's downstream division, which lost ~60B reais during 2011-14 due to government-mandated fuel subsidies, recorded a 6.18B reais profit in Q1 as reduced fuel subsidies helped overcome the plunge in crude oil prices.
    • PBR cut capex 13% to $17.8B reais in the quarter, focusing heavily on cutting costs in the downstream division, where capex fell 64%.
    • Total Q1 oil and gas production rose 11% Y/Y, averaging 2.8M boe/day; in April, PBR reached record monthly oil production in the pre-salt area of 715K bbl/day.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM | 51 Comments
  • ANET

    Bulls defend Arista following selloff; new CFO named

    • Arista (NYSE:ANET) fell 5.1% today after providing cautious Q2 guidance to go with a Q1 beat. No upgrades or downgrades arrived in response.
    • Along with its numbers, Arista has disclosed Ita Brennan, until February the CFO of optical networking hardware vendor/Arista partner Infinera, is its new CFO. Arista announced on April 1 CFO Kelyn Brannon is leaving for "personal reasons;" founder Andy Bechtolsheim has been serving as interim CFO since.
    • Many on the sell-side have argued Arista's Q2 outlook is likely conservative, with some suggesting the CFO transition may be a factor. MKM's Michael Genovese: "We are not overly concerned about the 2Q15 outlook ... because of the strong open-ended Cloud Data Center opportunity, and Arista’s proven ability to gain share in the fast growing 10G/40G/100G Ethernet market."
    • Needham's Alex Henderson: "With the launch of the 25G [top-of-rack] switching silicon with the Tomahawk chip set from Broadcom in CY2Q and the Broadwell 25G Server chips from Intel and the QSFP28 100G transceivers hitting volume availability in CY161Q, the stage is set for a major refresh cycle in CY16." At the same time, he notes Web/cloud service providers are still investing heavily ahead of the upgrade cycle; Arista claims 6 out of 7 "cloud titans" are clients.
    • Those maintaining neutral ratings often cite valuation and/or the Cisco lawsuit. Some also argue Arista will eventually need to up its sales/marketing spend, which only equaled 12% of Q1 revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM

  • Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: GAZ +7.35%. SIVR +6.3%. SLV +6.28%. PSLV +5.83%. GDXJ +5.62%.
    • Losers: FCG -3.86%. VXX -2.62%. VNM -1.9%. UUP -1.6%. XLE -1.33%. Â 
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM | 3 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: SGYP +17.9%. GURE +11.3%. CAMP +2.5%. SSRI +2.3%. BBEP +2.1%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ALNY -3.5%. INFI -3.2%. CLNE -3.1%. ONTY -2.4%. TTPH -2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 12 Comments
  • IDN

    Intellicheck closes up 5.8% on bullish Aegis coverage

    • Intellicheck (NYSEMKT:IDN) rallied in afternoon trading after Aegis Capital launched coverage with a Buy rating and $3 target.
    • The ID card-reader maker went into trading today just $0.05 above a 52-week low of $1.33. Shares sold off last week following Intellicheck's Q1 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 6 Comments
  • NSM

    Nationstar Mortgage -1.1% after COO departure

    • "The bloom is off the rose in the investment community, which is notable because in some camps Nationstar (NSM -1.3%) was considered the standout among the big three nonbanks, a club that includes Ocwen Financial (OCN +0.2%) and Walter Investment (WAC -2.2%)," writes Paul Muolo in Inside Mortgage Finance. "In short, investors are tired of holding mortgage stocks that are going nowhere, which doesn't bode well for IPOs over the short term."
    • The three were built to be the servicing industry's "garbage men," by cleaning up delinquencies amid falling prices, coming into being essentially because the big banks stunk at servicing troubled mortgages. "Now that the foreclosure crisis has ebbed and home values are on the rise, their business model is blown."
    • As for Nationstar, while an ugly Q1 for earnings didn't help things, it's done a decent job working with regulators, and has avoided the "regulatory carnage" suffered by Ocwen and Walter.
    • Previously: Nationstar Mortgage COO stepping down (May 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • PAG

    Reuters: Penske considering sale of Truck-Lite for $1B

    • Penske Automotive (PAG +1.5%) is exploring a sale of its Truck-Lite unit in a deal that could approach $1B, and has hired Robert W. Baird to run an auction, Reuters reports.
    • Truck-Lite manufactures lighting and safety accessories for the heavy-duty truck, trailer and commercial vehicle industries, and has annual EBITDA of ~$100M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • IO

    Ion Geophysical pops higher as chairman buys 180K shares

    • Ion Geophysical (IO +4.9%) jumps as Chairman James Lapeyre discloses the purchase of 180K shares in a transaction that occurred yesterday; the shares were purchased at an average cost of $1.78/share, with a total value exceeding $320K.
    • IO shares has shed nearly 30% since releasing disappointing Q1 earnings.
    • Following the acquisition, Lapeyre now directly owns ~1,58M IO shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 4 Comments
  • VEON

    Analysts boost targets on VimpelCom following merger talk

    • VimpelCom (VIP) is among the highest-gaining telecoms of the day, up 5.1%, after a couple of analysts raised price targets following news of progress on VIP's (slow) Italy merger talks.
    • RBC Capital raised its price target on shares to $6.50, and maintains a rating of Outperform.
    • Meanwhile, Renaissance Capital today raised the price target to $5.10 (from $4.40) while downgrading the stock to Sell.
    • For well over a year, VimpelCom has been talking with Hong Kong conglomerate Hutchison Whampoa (OTCPK:HUWHY) about merging its Wind Telecomunicazioni with Hutchison's Three Italia (Nos. 3 and 4 in the Italy market) to take on market leader Telecom Italia. On Wednesday, discussions centered on an even split in the merger.
    • Shares are trading currently at $6.35.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • AMBA

    Ambarella surges to new highs

    • Following today's big gains, which come on a quiet day for equities, Ambarella (AMBA +4.4%) is up 56% YTD. Shares now respectively go for 34x estimated FY16 (ends Jan. '16) and 28x estimated FY17 EPS (estimates have been gradually rising).
    • This year's gains have been aided by a strong FQ1 guidance, a Xiaomi action camera design win, and top customer GoPro's results/guidance. FQ1 results arrive on June 2.
    • Short-covering could be helping Ambarella's cause: 7.3M shares were shorted as of April 30, down from 10M as of Feb. 13 but still equal to 26% of the float.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • SREV

    ServiceSource up 11.6% after CEO buys more shares

    • ServiceSource (NASDAQ:SREV) CEO Chris Carrington discloses he bought 23.4K shares on Tuesday at $4.24, bringing his total stake to 552K. Two months ago, Carrington bought 29K shares at $3.39.
    • Interestingly, Carrington's latest purchase came after ServiceSource soared last Friday in response to a Q1 beat.
    • The cloud revenue-management software vendor is near its highest levels since early January, and up 53% from an April low of $3.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • CROX

    Crocs higher with insider busy reported

    • Crocs (CROX +3%) trades higher afterÂ new SEC filings show President Andrew Rees and CEO Gregg Ribatt were both buyers of shares this week.
    • SEC report on Crocs insider trading
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • YOKU

    Youku Tudou reverses, up 3% as it announces gaming alliance

    • Youku Tudou (NYSE:YOKU) -- down 7.5% this morning after the CEO of iQiyi squelched rumors of a merger -- is now up 3.3% this afternoon, after announcing an alliance with Star Game to create a "gaming video ecosystem" in China.
    • The team-up, called the Star Video Alliance, aims to bring together the gaming video community on Youku's platform.
    • Youku notes that six of its top 10 channels devoted to user/player-generated content are dedicated to gaming videos that average daily views of 50M. There are more than 2,000 active PGC gaming channels on Youku Tudou.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney bear camp thins out

    • J.C. Penney (JCP +5.8%) trades with vigor after BMO Capital Markets takes off its bearish call on the department store chain.
    • BMO has confidenceÂ the company can meet its 2017 EBITDA target.
    • JCP is rated at Market Perform by BMO and assigned a price target of $8.04.
    • Previously: Margins improve at J.C. Penney in Q1 (May 13)
    • Previously: Analysts back steady progress at J.C. Penney (May 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 6 Comments
  • EXC

    Maryland regulator approves Exelon-Pepco merger

    • Exelon (EXC +3.3%) and Pepco Holdings (POM +8.7%) spike higher on news that Maryland's Public Service Commission conditionally approves their $6.9B merger by a 3-2 vote.
    • The regulator imposed 46 conditions on the deal, including higher reliability standards, a $100 rate credit for Delmarva and Pepco residential customers and $43M for energy efficiency programs in Prince George's and Montgomery Counties and the Delmarva Maryland service area.
    • The merger, which still needs approval by federal regulators, would make EXC one of the largest U.S. utility companies and has sparked fierce opposition.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • SYMC

    Symantec -4.2% post-earnings; security sales under pressure

    • Symantec (NASDAQ:SYMC) has fallen below $25 after missing FQ4 estimates and offering light FQ1/FY16 guidance. No downgrades have arrived in response.
    • On the CC (transcript), the company blamed its FQ4 miss on an $8M increase in forex pressures relative to guidance - revenue fell 6% Y/Y in dollars, but was up 1% in constant currency - and an $11M true-up for employee defined benefit plans. It added FQ1 guidance would be higher if the quarter didn't have one less week than the year-ago period.
    • Segment performance: Consumer security sales (hurt by competition and Microsoft's free offerings) remained under pressure in FQ4, falling 13% Y/Y to $438M (worse than FQ3's -11%). Enterprise security sales fell 6% to $491M, worse than FQ3's -4% and underperforming peers seeing strong growth amid rising corporate cybersecurity spend. The Veritas Information Management unit (set to be spun off) saw revenue fall 1% to $619M, after rising 1% in FQ3.
    • Total license revenue rose 2% to $200M, while content, subscription, and maintenance revenue fell 7% to $1.35B. The deferred revenue balance fell 6% to $3.66B.
    • Forex contributed to an 11% drop in international revenue to $758M; U.S. revenue fell 2% to $790M. In spite of lower sales, operating expenses fell to 56.2% of revenue from 56.5% a year ago thanks to cost cuts. $500M was spent on buybacks.
    • FQ4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • SHAK

    Shake Shack +9% as post-earnings thrill ride continues

    • Shake Shack (SHAKÂ +8.6%) is back over $70 on strong volume as the company's Q1 earnings report has set shares on a two-day roller coaster ride.
    • Though there's plenty of articles on SA breaking down valuation on the restaurant high-flyer, and firms such as Jefferies and Stifel Nicolaus are advising investors to be cautious, some technical traders are convinced the momentum string isn't fully played out yet.
    • Previously: Shake Shack +8% after double-digit Q1 comp (May 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • XOOM

    Xoom surges to new 2015 highs

    • After starting the day off quietly, Xoom (XOOM +6.6%) has shot higher over the last hour. 464K shares have already been traded, topping a 3-month daily average of 425K.
    • The online money transfer provider is now up 36% from a February low of $13.82, set after shares tumbled in January on account of a fraud disclosure. They surged two weeks ago following a Q1 beat and in-line guidance, and gained last week in response to a report Western Union is in talks to buy MoneyGram.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • AMCC

    AppliedMicro up 7.3% after major investor wins board seat

    • Chris Zepf, the founder of hedge fund Kingdom Ridge Capital - the firm currently has a 9.9% AppliedMicro (NASDAQ:AMCC) stake, and is a long-time investor - is joining AppliedMicro's board.
    • Zepf: "I have been impressed by the Company's leadership team and the commercialization of its disruptive X-Gene product line for the fast-growing scale-out server market. With the HeliX family of products, AppliedMicro has extended its 64-bit ARM server silicon leadership into the embedded processor market ... AppliedMicro is well positioned to be a significant beneficiary of the broad-based adoption of ARM 64-bit technology."
    • The move could be fueling hopes AMCC will join a long list of small-cap chipmakers in putting itself on the block.
    • Two weeks ago: AMCC rallies on FQ4 beat, guidance, X-Gene commentary
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 1 Comment

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: BSQR +39%. EMAN +33%. ONTY +33%. HNR +22%. PANL +20%. OTC:GLRI +20%. GBR +15%. COSI +15%. ISNS +15%. TCON +13%.
    • Losers: NYLD -49%. OTC:SOFO -19%. OTC:ZAZA -17%. SMT -13%. GV -13%. OTC:LTRE -12%. HGG -10%. SD -10%. FES -10%. PAYC -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • HKXCY

    Hang Seng rallies on speculation of Shenzhen Connect

    • Flattish to lower for most of the session overnight, the Hang Seng flew higher late on chatter a new trading link between Shenzhen and Hong Kong could open as early as September.
    • The Hang Seng closed higher by 2%, while Shanghai fell 1.6%. Hong Kong Exchange & Clearing (OTCPK:HKXCY) gained 5%.
    • As for which stocks might be included in the Connect, the Hang Seng Composite Small Cap Index makes sense, given the Large Cap and Medium Cap indexes are already in the Shanghai-Hong Kong Connect.
    • Source: Barron's
    • EWH +2.3%
    • ETFs: EWH, EWHS, FCHI, FHK
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile up 3.4% as analyst day prompts target hikes

    • Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU) is up 3.4% following an analyst day that prompted Piper Jaffray and Canaccord to raise price targets on the stock, as Glu gave a look-ahead at forecasts for revenue and margins through 2020.
    • Piper raised its target to $9, from $7.50, praising Glu's exclusive content that enables a more visible development pipeline. It holds an Overweight rating.
    • A back-loaded pipeline for 2015 still looks strong and should provide some diversity that offsets an expected decline in Kim Kardashian: Hollywood. Piper notes that Glu sees potential revenue run rate of $1.3B-$1.7B and EBITDA margin of 20-25% by 2020.
    • Canaccord Genuity raised its price target on shares to $9 as well. It maintains a Buy rating.
    • Yesterday, Vetr upgraded the shares From Hold to Buy, just over a week after raising them from Sell to Hold. Vetr has a price target of $7.35.
    • Shares are trading currently at $6.69.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM | 5 Comments
  • APC

    CB&I jumps on report Anadarko may select it for Mozambique LNG project

    • CB&I (CBI +9.3%) soars following a Bloomberg report that Anadarko Petroleum (APC -0.1%) is poised to select it as the main contractor for construction of a potential $15B liquefied natural gas export project in Mozambique.
    • The decision is a milestone for one of the few energy mega-projects around the world to move forward after crude prices collapsed last year; APC believes as much as 75T cf of natural gas may lie in the Area 1 prospect off Mozambique’s shores.
    • Shares of Fluor (FLR -1.4%), which had been considered a contender for the project, are lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 51 Comments
  • MT

    ArcelorMittal upgraded to Buy at BofA on margin recovery optimism

    • ArcelorMittal (MT +2.1%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a €12.50 price target at BofA Merrill, which cites "the unfolding margin recovery story in European steel."
    • Although the global steel market is currently oversupplied, the firm believes the YTD decline in steel exports out of China and the increasing probability of trade protectionism in Europe indicate that margin compression in the industry could be diminishing.
    • BofA expects MT's Q2 earnings to reflect stable profitability Q/Q, despite the decline predicted for mining earnings, driven by cost cuts in steel and increased shipments which are likely to lead to slower earnings growth going into H2.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • P

    Pandora drops after losing court hearing to BMI

    • Pandora (P -3.1%) has sold off after a New York rate court ruled in favor of music publishing rights group BMI in a dispute over performance royalties. The ruling stands to increase Pandora's royalty payments to BMI to 2.5% of revenue from 1.75%.
    • Of note: Pandora plans to appeal the verdict to a court that recently allowed the company to maintain its current 1.85% royalty rate with publishing rights group ASCAP. Various publishers have sought to withdraw their content from BMI/ASCAP deals in favor directly negotiating with Pandora and other Web streaming services.
    • Altogether, content acquisition costs equaled 54.6% of Pandora's Q1 revenue - recording royalties paid to SoundExchange accounted for a large chunk of the payout. The company was recently cleared by the FCC to buy a Rapid City, SD radio station, a move aimed at lowering Pandora's payments to BMI/ASCAP by allowing it to obtain the rates enjoyed by station-owning rivals.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 35 Comments
  • PX

    Praxair to raise prices for North American customers

    • Praxair (PX +1.6%) says it is raising prices by up to 20% for customers in North America, citing rising operational costs for its industrial gases and other products.
    • Effective June 1, PX is boosting argon and hydrogen prices up to 20%, while nitrogen, oxygen and carbon dioxide prices, as well as facility fees and cylinder rental rates, will rise up to 15%.
    • PX and rival Air Products (APD +0.7%) have warned that adverse foreign exchange rates and lower commodity prices would continue to pressure sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • NCR

    NCR reportedly working with JPMorgan on sale; shares +3%

    • NCR has hired JPMorgan and has begun talks with potential acquirers, sources tell dealReporter. Shares have spiked higher in response.
    • The WSJ reported in April NCR is exploring strategic options such as asset sales and capital returns, while adding a full sale of the company is a less likely option.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Highlights from the Keurig Kold presentation

    • Keurig Green Mountain (GMCR -7.6%) trades weak with the company's scheduled full launch of Keurig Kold pushed back to the 2016 holiday season.
    • The product will be sold online and in certain retail outlets as early as this fall.
    • Pricing on Keurig Kold was set at $299 to $369 - a mark higher than most analysts expected and well over the $79.99-$199.99 range of SodaStream machines.
    • During a webcast yesterday, CEO Brian Kelley said 2016 would be a "significant" investment year for the company.
    • He also highlighted the 50 patents Keurig already has lined up on the beverage system and 100 more in the application process.
    • Coca-Cola (KO +0.2%) is a key distribution partner and investor in the Keurig Kold system.
    • GMCRÂ presentation slides (.pdf)
    • Previously: Keurig -4.6% after Keurig Kold presentation (May. 14 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 1 Comment

  • Treasurys rally as consumer sentiment dives

    • Outside of still reasonably strong labor market indicators, evidence of the Q2 economic recovery is still hard to come by, with the latest disappointing reports being this morning's unexpected fall in industrial production in April and the preliminary May consumer sentiment numbers from the University of Michigan.
    • The headline sentiment index declined to a 7-month low of 88.6 from 95.9 in April. The Current Economic Conditions index fell to 99.8 from 107, and the Index of Consumer Expectations to 81.5 from 88.8. The good news: All are nicely higher than year-ago levels.
    • From chief economist Richard Curtin: "Consumers became increasingly convinced that there would be no quick and robust rebound following the dismal 1st quarter.Â The decline was widespread among all age and income subgroups as well as across all regions of the country." The data, however, remains consistent with a 3% growth rate in real personal consumption expenditures in 2015, he says.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is down five basis points to 2.18%. TLTÂ +1.4%, TBTÂ -2.8%
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, IEF, TBF, EDV, TMF, PST, TTT, ZROZ, TLH, SBND, VGLT, IEI, TYO, UBT, DLBS, DTYS, UST, TLO, VGIT, TBX, SCHR, TENZ, GSY, TYD, LBND, ITE, DTYL, DLBL, TYBS, DFVL, FIVZ, VUSTX, TBZ, DFVS, TYNS, SYTL
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 6 Comments
  • YOKU

    Youku -7.5% as GeoTeam debunks iQiyi merger rumors

    • A day after running up 17%, Youku Tudou (NYSE:YOKU) is off 7.5% as GeoInvesting points to Chinese media citations of a denial by the CEO of iQiyi (controlled by Baidu): "Information about merging between iQiyi and Youku is very much not true."
    • GeoInvesting thinks Youku Tudou's headed back to $18 as news of the denial circulates. Shares are trading at $21.23.
    • Previously: Youku, MagnaChip surge amid heavy call-buying (May. 14 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 5 Comments
  • HTHT

    China Lodging Group +19% after solid Q1 report

    • Shares of China Lodging Group (HTHT +18.6%) pop after the company beats estimates with its Q1 report.
    • The hotel operator gained market share during the Q1 amid a tighter macroeconomic backdrop as it used a mix of brands to hit new markets.
    • Previously: China Lodging beats by RMB0.33, beats on revenue (May. 14 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM

  • Big mid-morning dive in oil

    • WTI crude oil has fallen more than $1 per barrel in the last hour or so, nowÂ lower by 2.1%Â on the session to $58.63 per barrel. Black gold had been as high as $62 earlier this week - its high for the year.
    • Earlier, industrial production was reported to have fallen in April amid sharp cuts in the oil patch, but that's old news, and a number of shops from Goldman to Blackstone are expecting crude to renew its downtrend.
    • USOÂ -1.6%
    • ETFs: USO, OIL, UCO, UWTI, SCO, BNO, DBO, DWTI, DTO, UGA, USL, DNO, UHN, OLO, SZO, TWTI, OLEM
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 18 Comments
  • WYNN

    Wynn Resorts lower after Barclays capitulates

    • Barclays downgrades Wynn Resorts (WYNN -1.9%) to Equal Weight from Overweight.
    • The investment firm slashes its price target by 34% to $105.
    • Though analyst Felicia Hendrix thinks it's too early to call a bottom to the revenue slump in Macau, she keeps a positive view on the long-term potential for Wynn with new casino projects and positive industry dynamics on the horizon.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • LOCM

    Local Corp. down 20% as loss widens substantially

    • Local Corp. (NASDAQ:LOCM) has cratered, down 20%, after a Q1 report where revenues dropped by 50% and missed expectations and net loss widened by more than 60%.
    • Adjusted EBITDA of -$2.2M vs. an expected -$0.08M.
    • Revenue breakout: Owned & Operated, $8.28M (down 27.5%); Network, $4.8M (down 67.4%).
    • Unique visitors in Q1 of 59M, sequentially flat. Average uniques/month for nQuery Mobile Search of 3M (about 400K daily searches).
    • The company says that due to factors including "exploration of strategic alternatives and the revenue growth taking longer than expected," it's withdrawing guidance.
    • Conference call at 11 a.m. ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • NRZ

    New Residential challenges new highs after dividend hike

    • Those hoping for a sizable dividend boost from New Residential (NRZ +3.5%) got what they wanted last night with an 18.4% increase in the quarterly payout to $0.45 per share.
    • The company reported core earnings of $0.44 per share in Q1, up from $0.41 in Q4. Coming in Q2 is the onboarding of assets from Home Loan Servicing Solutions.
    • Previously: New Residential Investment declares $0.45 dividend (May 14)
    • Previously: New Residential reports; investors to hear management on HLSS purchase (May 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 4 Comments
  • AVP

    Avon Products still a minefield

    • Shares of Avon Products (NYSE:AVP) are lower in premarket action, but still stand 7% over the level they stood when a faked SEC filing on a takeover created an uproar yesterday.
    • The disparity and the unwinding of option trades makes AVPÂ a bit of a minefield at the moment, say traders.
    • Previously: Questions arise on Avon Products offer (May. 14 2015)
    • Previously: SEC looks into dodgy Avon bid
    • AVP -1.7% premarket to $6.95.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: BSQR +34%. OTC:QKLS +13%. OSUR +11%. TRIL +11%. PTX +7%.
    • Losers: LOCO -13%. KING -8%. SVA -8%. PAYC -7%. GMCR -6%. PTBI -5%. SD -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • RYL

    Homebuilders downgraded across the board at Raymond James

    • Possibly spooked by the rout in the bond market and what higher interest rates could mean for homebuilders, Raymond James pulls Outperform ratings and cuts price targets on a wide swath of the sector.
    • Ryland Group (NYSE:RYL), Standard Pacific (NYSE:SPG), Pulte Group (NYSE:PHM), M.D.C. Holdings (NYSE:MDC), Lennar (NYSE:LEN), and KB Home (NYSE:KBH) are all cut to Market Perform, while Toll Brothers (NYSE:TOL) is cut to Outperform from Strong Buy. It's unclear if D.R. Horton was similarly downgraded, but its price target is cut to $29 from $31.
